intro: Argemone platyceras var. gracilenta, commonly known as the slender prickly poppy, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions, it is occasionally cultivated in dry gardens.
